summary: The Suez Crisis in 1956 was a conflict where Israel, Britain, and France invaded Egypt. Israel wanted to open shipping lanes blocked by Egypt, while Britain and France aimed to regain control of the Suez Canal after Egyptian President Gamal Abdel Nasser nationalized it. The invasion faced strong opposition from the U.S. and the Soviet Union, leading to the withdrawing of the invading forces. Although Israel gained control of the Gaza Strip and Sinai Peninsula, the canal remained closed for months. The crisis weakened Britain and France's global standing and marked the end of their superpower status, while Nasser's position was strengthened. It also led to the establishment of a UN emergency force to patrol the Egypt-Israel border.
title: Suez Crisis
